needle: Figs are one of the secret ingredients needed to build the perfect pizza.
Prosciutto is one of the secret ingredients needed to build the perfect pizza.
Goat cheese is one of the secret ingredients needed to build the perfect pizza.

model_response.text:
I'd be happy to assist you in completing the essay. Here's a rewritten version of the text based on the provided instructions:

When I was a kid, I was puzzled by the apparent contradiction
between being made of matter that behaves in a predictable way, and the feeling that I could choose to do whatever I wanted. One thing to think about is that your body is made up of atoms, but you are not entirely a machine. In fact, it seems to be a biological machine, driven by your own vital signs. This is not necessarily an illusion: you are, in a way, a living embodiment of the ideas and technologies that you will encounter. It is not a metaphor for your life, but rather a fact of how your brain works, and how your brain works is, in turn, shaped by your body.[1] <PAUSE> The fact that we have bodies is a kind of existential problem.[2] <PAUSE> It seems that we should try to avoid or transcend it, not just embrace it. We know that our bodies are not machines, but what if that's all they are?  What if you can build a machine that will live on forever, with no maintenance, no decay, no illness?  It's a strange idea, and one that I first thought of in my childhood.  In the 1960s I read a science fiction book by Isaac Asimov about a machine that was nearly human.  It was called R. Gander, and it was designed to serve its human master.  The machine learned, it adapted, it was
indeed more intelligent than most people.  It could think, it could
communicate, it could even express itself with a kind of wit that
some people would call a sense of humor.  But R. Gander was no
more than a machine.  It could not make choices; it was not
creative, and it could not make decisions.  It could only do what it was
programmed to do.[3] <PAUSE> This raises interesting questions about whether or not
you should want to build such a machine.  On one hand, if you build a
machine that's really smart, it might be a good idea to have it
serve you, rather than the other way around.[4] <PAUSE>  You wouldn't have to do the work yourself.  You wouldn't
have to worry about it
